node.title: Oxford High School Officials May Be Charged in School Shooting, Prosecutor Says
node.alt: Officials at the Michigan high school where a deadly shooting took place last week could possibly face charges after new information came to light about the days and hours leading up to the attack. Students hug at a memorial at Oxford High School in Oxford, Mich., Wednesday, Dec. 1, 2021.
node.description: "In this case a lot could have been done different," Oakland County Prosecutor Karen McDonald said.
node.content:
["Officials at the Michigan high school where a deadly shooting took place last week could possibly face charges after new information came to light about the days and hours leading up to the attack, the Associated Press reported.", "Oakland County Prosecutor Karen McDonald, who charged alleged shooter Ethan Crumbley's parents last week in a rare move, said that an investigation into the shooting will determine whether charges against school officials are warranted.", "\"In this case, a lot could have been done different. I mean at that meeting he was allowed to go back to school,\" McDonald said Monday during an interview on ABC's Good Morning America, referencing a meeting school officials called with Crumbley and his parents hours before the attack.", "\"We know that he either had that weapon with him or someplace where he could have stored it in the school. But he had it in the school, there's no question. And leaving the decision to parents about whether he goes home or not...\" she added but did not finish the sentence.", "This is a breaking story and will be updated.", "", "
Officials at the Michigan high school where a deadly shooting took place last week could possibly face charges after new information came to light about the days and hours leading up to the attack. Students hug at a memorial at Oxford High School in Oxford, Mich., Wednesday, Dec. 1, 2021.
"]
